synopsis: Recently David Ing suggested that we have too many ways to search or at least too many ways labeled "search". Let's attack this problem by growing our labels from a single verb, search, to short phrases. [https://matrix.to/#/!ORfrUEFeWFcHAMLFLr:matrix.org/$1553398247594835foxaY:matrix.org?via=matrix.org&via=matrix.allmende.io&via=tomesh.net riot]

synopsis: I've been writing here long enough to find myself searching for pages I'd written years ago. It is getting easier because I've adopted techniques that make the hunt more effective.

synopsis: This page is some initial thoughts and experiments with searching the Federated Wiki sites. What is id doing on Decentralised Academy site?

title: Sensor Server Wind Damage
synopsis: The high hot winds of September, 2020, blew trees down and launched wild fires that raised the Portland smoke danger to extreme for a week. It also broke my moisture sensor which had been serving me for a decade.

title: Server Startup
synopsis: We run a few servers in screen jobs. We restart these after power failures.

synopsis: Using microservices on AWS. Is this to wiki's advantage? Can we exploit it without becoming it? See [[Computational Habitat]]

title: Service Blocks
synopsis: We would like to generalize the Datalog plugin with block-based programming that will recognize or generate events and then invoke diverse activity based on what happens. The block model provides a "toolbox" of operations subject to assembly constraints promising no syntax errors ever.

title: Service Logic
synopsis: We consider how server-side plugins can assemble and maintain coordinated services under the guidance of transient client-side plugin configurations. See [[Alert Prototype]]

title: Serving Executables
synopsis: We've taken a step back from the increasing complexity driven by our early experiments in [[Outpost Thinking]]. We set the client aside for a moment and ask if we can hack an existing deno server to run executable helpers as if they were CGI scripts. [https://github.com/joshuabenuck/seran-sudoku github]

title: Servo Developer Preview
synopsis: Servo is a modern, high-performance browser engine being developed for application and embedded use.

synopsis: How can I share the power I have over my digital work? I test this by considering what controls I must apply to make the Shell plugin safe for distribution.

title: Signature Plugin

title: Simple Login Alternative

title: Sitemap Failures
synopsis: We notice that scrapes take longer and longer. A pet theory is that sitemap fetches are timing out. We've changed the curl -m time limit from 10 to 5 seconds. Now we wonder what effect that will have.

title: Sitemap Scrape Statistics
synopsis: We collect various counts while scraping sitemaps and report them as a text file. Here we plot the most recent counts available.

title: Sites Claimed
synopsis: We've made it unexpectedly easy to make and claim a site. We have no terms of service, but for claimed sites we have an email so we could alert users of changes such as migration from persona.

title: Sites for Friends
synopsis: We consider how we might provide just sufficient security for a small community of friends to form quickly, enjoy ownership, invite others and recover from mistakes.

title: Small Steps
synopsis: This is [[work-in-progress]]. We outline below some steps that help bring us closer to the goal of creating a new form of decentralised conversation:

title: Solid Programmers
synopsis: I often draw symbols like these in 2d with circles, squares, trapezoids shaded in gradient gray.

title: Solve for Initial Conditions
synopsis: The g9 library will adjust algorithmic drawings such that any element can be moved. When someone interacts with the graphics, for example by trying to drag an element to a new position, g9 optimizes over the space of possible values for your data to find a set of values that comes closest to creating the change. From MIT. [http://omrelli.ug/g9/gallery/ post]

title: Sorting and Searching
synopsis: We have many kinds of things and they can move about. How will we ever find them, make sense of them, see what is missing, wonder at our accomplishment?

synopsis: We construct a diagram seeded with [[Thompson's Anchors]] used five or more times. [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/WardCunningham/thompson-anchors/master/map.svg?sanitize=true enlarge]

title: Thought Soup
synopsis: We reflect on this happening using the metaphorical model of soup as in primordial soup or even stone soup.

title: Three Layer Storage
synopsis: I have improved some code paths in pageHandler but there are many opportunities for simplification remaining. I have worked slowly here because many cases have order sensitivities due to the compounding of function.

title: Three Ways We Must Think
synopsis: Alan Kay explains, In order to be completely enfranchised in the 21st century, it will be very important for children to get fluent in the three central forms of thinking that are now in use: "stories," "logical arguments," and "systems dynamics." [http://worrydream.com/refs/Kay%20-%20Powerful%20Ideas%20Need%20Love%20Too.html page]

title: Timer Logic
synopsis: We'd like to manage timers server-side with convenient and fool proof client-side controls. [https://github.com/WardCunningham/wiki-plugin-datalog/commits/master github]

title: Tips For Deleting Sites
synopsis: Our create on first access can lead to may junk sites. Here we look for safe strategies for removing them.

title: Tips for Modeling
synopsis: We suggest an incremental approach where new sources are added to a daily build and explored with ad-hoc queries before choosing a more permanent representation as nodes and relations.

title: Tips from Biology
synopsis: We have always been inspired by genetics and population dynamics but know that these mechanisms alone fall short of full explanations of life. Here we catalog subjects from which we can borrow more.

title: Tips from Education
synopsis: Thompson Morrison and I have been pushing on reimagining education and engineering. Here we learn from his success.

title: Tips from Erlang
synopsis: We've sought advice from Fred Heberts which we collect here without too much concern for provenance.

title: Title Network Browser
synopsis: From one starting point this web application displays reachable titles following links forward or backwards two hops. Find a link to this interactive tool in the caption to the right.

title: Title Space in File Browsing
synopsis: We thought our deno based wiki server would be good for exposing aspects of resources not easily moved. We picked the host computer's file system as something interesting that we might want to browse.

title: Top Maintenance Priorities
synopsis: We expect the various features of wiki to work in support of common workflows. We've endured inconvenience in cases where these features are incomplete or unreliable.

title: Topic Based Subsets
synopsis: We pick topics that have been of lasting interest and subset them into their own federated wiki sites. These sites are the culmination of a project to  [[Subset Wiki]].

title: TopicQuests Nodes
synopsis: TopicQuests LiteWeight experimental hypertext. [http://context.asia.wiki.org/plugin/json/topicquests-nodes data]

title: Touch Support
synopsis: Browsing with touch is awkward at best. Editing is nearly impossible. We've adopted some compatibility plugin that trades one set of confusions for another. We have to take touch events into our own hands.

title: Transformation Visualizer
synopsis: We consider how an advanced handheld and networked device could connect people, place and method in purposeful collaboration. See [[Flutter Client]]

title: Transient Identity
synopsis: I'm trying to imagine the use case @opn is exploring. I think it works like this:

title: Transport Forms
synopsis: We've borrowed most of the transporter logic and added it to one special case of the Html plugin: submitting forms.

title: Transport Infrastructure
synopsis: We imagine how a component like we see in Transporters could become a casual ecosystem of open computational behavior.

title: Transport Plugin
synopsis: The Transport Plugin is the name given to the plugin idea initially described here:

title: Transported Graphviz
synopsis: This graph represents the merge of all graph-source to the left of the transport page.

title: Transported Image
synopsis: Drag and drop this image into the desired page.

title: Transporter
synopsis: Here we describe the present state and future directions of the Transporter concept.

title: Transporter Roster
synopsis: Transporters are public services that transform available content into federated wiki pages.

title: Transporting Hypertext
synopsis: We ask, how might we merge the interface features of the Transport plugin with persistent foreign servers that could support continued on-demand transclusions of large hypertexts.

title: Trending Conversations
synopsis: We've written a script that refreshes a static html page with links to the trending conversations. This version doesn't depend on you loading up your neighborhood to see our whole community. [http://fed.wiki.org/trending.html webpage]

title: Tufte CSS
synopsis: A beautiful CSS template for text based on the work of Edward Tufte. [http://www.daveliepmann.com/tufte-css/ web]

title: Turtle Spirals
synopsis: This javascript snippet and the installed turtle items are the results of an experiment with [[Outpost Thinking]].

title: Tweets in Natural Order
synopsis: Twitter's algorithm confounds and annoys. But their search, when asked politely, will give you what you expect. Try this link. [https://twitter.com/search?f=tweets&q=filter%3Afollows%20-filter%3Areplies&src=typd twitter]

title: Two Constituencies
synopsis: There are two constituencies for products: the aspirin crowd and the coffee crowd. The metaphor contrasts need with desire. Lasting products meet needs.

title: UDP Reporting and Requests
synopsis: The WSJT-X ham radio digital signaling application will report decoding status and accept requests by UDP datagrams. Here we explore how to avail ourselves of that service. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_Datagram_Protocol wikipedia]

title: Unexpected Server Restarts
synopsis: Our WSJT plugin maintains a one-hour buffer and reports statistics on its contents when asked by a Datalog. We see the buffer inexplicably empties about once a day.

title: Unicode Titles
synopsis: The full unicode title is present in the json and can be reproduced in the link. A server could index pages by full title and offer to retrieve them with something like a url friendly version of base64 passed as a query parameter on page fetch.

title: Uptime Table
synopsis: We're collecting availability stats from recorded exit status provided by a Datalog plugin curl extension. Here we report these as uptime percentages in tabular form.

title: URLs not Idempotent
synopsis: [[Recent Changes]] has a single URL but its content varies according to how much of the network is loaded by other pages mentioned in the URL. The amount of network that will be loaded also depends on what is on Tim's Welcome Visitors page. If Tim changes that page then Recent Changes will be different.

title: US Women's Weekly Earnings
synopsis: We test with US Women's weekly earnings. [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Data:Bls.gov/US_Women%27s_weekly_earnings_as_a_percent_of_men%27s_by_age,_annual_averages.tab commons]

title: User-mode Preeminence
synopsis: At the moment Fedwiki is constructed in the interest of the writer, we may even say the advanced writer. Let's call this mode of experience the Author Mode.

title: Utopia Studios: 04
synopsis: Music, mobile interface, and multi-channel sound for the #BuildingUtopia project.

title: Video Reporter Producer
synopsis: We consider how wiki could capture, produce and then deliver compelling video stories. We will imagine an end-to-end workflow based on one industry pattern for news stories about people doing things. We're confident many other kinds of stories could be configured into video pattern languages on wiki pages.

title: Viewing Graphviz with Javascript
synopsis: I'd like to view a graphviz file in wiki. I can process it on the server but it seems difficult to get any rich format to display on the screen. Of course I want links so this makes image formats a non-starter. What's with svg anyway?

title: Visitor as Schema
synopsis: Small discovery of the day: Algorithmic markup in one plugin interprets the meaning of the remainder of the page which should be designed with this cooperation in mind.

title: Visualizing High-Order Graphs
synopsis: How might we draw meaningful diagrams of wiki that don't turn quickly into a fuzzball of links?

title: Wants and Needs
synopsis: These are ideas that we've thought about over and over but not done yet. Soon. See also [[Finished Work]].

title: Ward Cunningham
synopsis: I have lots of ambition for federated wiki which I have explored at times and deferred to more mundane needs other times. Here I can describe ideas without declaring them as accepted direction.

title: Ward on Wiki
synopsis: These sites address specific aspects of wiki often written for different audiences. We start with the most general or introductory and progress to the more detailed, speculative, or historical.

title: Ward's Home Page
synopsis: I've lived my whole life in Indiana and Oregon. When maps became available online I sought to use them to document all of my homes. I called it my "home page" as a joke since that usually refers to a home in cyberspace. [http://c2.com/~ward/home/ site]

title: Weak Wholeness
synopsis: We consider visible and hidden links that make pages whole. Of special concern is where technology strengthens the whole or destroys it by accident.

title: Web Bluetooth
synopsis: Chrome 53 has an Origin Trial for Bluetooth, which means that websites can opt-in to use this feature and automatically enable Web Bluetooth for all their visitors. It is the first time such technology enabling IoT directly from the web is deployed in the wild. [https://medium.com/@urish/is-now-a-good-time-to-start-using-web-bluetooth-hint-yes-yes-it-is-99e998d7b9f6#.u9l7mnyww post]

title: Weeds in the Farm
synopsis: I've run the fed.wiki.org farm for three years. I've seen weeds sprout. I've weeded on occasion. I've not been stung but then I don't represent a public institution.

title: Weekly Roster
synopsis: We list sites in the visible federation active in a week of six hour period. Click » to add these to your neighborhood then see [[Recent Changes]] for details. Time in UTC.

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. From this page you can find who we are and what we do. New sites provide this information and then claim the site as their own. You will need your own site to participate.

title: Wendy Rose
synopsis: This stainless steel sculpture is shown in work clothes proudly donning a red glass polka dot scarf. [http://www.cityofvancouver.us/ourcity/page/wendy-rose page]

title: When Replicators Unite
synopsis: Major Evolutionary Transitions in Individuality ... characterized by individuals that could previously replicate independently,

title: When Their Time Is Right
synopsis: Much of what lives and survives is about timing, not essence. How do we care for ideas who's timing is wrong? How do we judge the right time for an idea?

title: Where Colleagues Live
synopsis: Here I identify residence locations for a colleague planning a trip to Portland. His specific request was advice on hip places to book a b&b and enjoy our bike culture. See [[Hip Portland]]

title: Where Pages Live
synopsis: We describe where the json representing a wiki page can be stored and how pages move between these stores.

title: White Origin
synopsis: A page from the origin shows with a white background and no border.

title: Why Write Books
synopsis: We've run into some coding difficulties deep in the core of wiki while exploring an improved [[Print Plugin]]. The questions escalate to those of representing dynamic behavior in a static medium. Here we explore how wiki should cooperate with ebooks and print on demand.

title: Wiki - 0.12
synopsis: Wiki v0.12 sees the introduction of ability to delete pages, together with a 'recycle bin' which will not only contain deleted pages but also pages that have been forked over. Also added is an assets directory.

title: Wiki Admin
synopsis: We consider how a production server could be managed with Shell plugin markup. Only a logged in administrator can run these scripts. See also [[Config Notes]]

title: Wiki and Open Data
synopsis: I found inspiration in learning about open data published by City of Boulder, County of Boulder, and State of Colorado.  Could this drive creation of El Dorado in wiki?

title: Wiki App Stack
synopsis: Here we recall from memory the organization of wiki as a collaborative application platform.

title: Wiki as Platform
synopsis: I am a continual proponent of the wiki style, where structure in the work emerges unmanaged by assumptions of programmers. This is the exact opposite of the sinister "algorithm" that now rules popular social software. I've now pushed this style into a computational realm where collaborators can do computing as well as talk about the computing they do. Every result ends up a story.

title: Wiki Browses Bikeshares
synopsis: Wiki assembles pages from various sites into a Lineup within which useful computations can take place. Here we use maps and bikeshare online data to illustrate how this works.

title: Wiki Config and wikiDomains
synopsis: While exploring wiki and kubernetes, your author discovered his own incorrect assumptions about the behavior of wikiDomains configuration. Here we describe what we were expecting—expressed as a goal for improved configuration code. We also consider changing cli.coffee and farm.coffee from coffee-script to es6 javascript.

title: Wiki Design Principles
synopsis: Wiki has turned out to be much more than I'd imagined! That is not to say that I didn't imagine a lot. These are the design principles I sought to satisfy with the first release of Wiki. -- [[Ward Cunningham]]

title: Wiki Edit Command Line
synopsis: We consider manual curation of pages containing automatically updated items to be a best practice. Perhaps we could support this with a command-line interface.

title: Wiki Events
synopsis: Describes the different event sources, producers, and clients used in wiki.

title: Wiki Find Page
synopsis: Here we simulate the remodeled Find Page from the original wiki except we find federated versions. [http://wiki.c2.com/?FindPage wiki]

title: Wiki Nature for VR
synopsis: Wiki added casual utility to hypertext. Can it do the same for virtual reality? What if everyone has a couple of viewers laying around. What might I post on wiki that would lead you to pick a viewer up?

title: Wiki on IPFS
synopsis: We imagine how wiki client code might maintain its permanent state in IPFS. We suggest an integration with the journal as currently implemented.

title: Wiki Relocation
synopsis: Here I record and perhaps refine the steps required to relocate a wiki. The wiki pages themselves should move easily. But the external configuration adjustments will involve many steps.

title: Wikimedia Research
synopsis: Wikimedia Research is a team of scientists and engineers using data to understand and empower millions of readers and contributors who interact with Wikipedia and its sister projects on a daily basis. [https://research.wikimedia.org/ site]

title: Wikimention
synopsis: Previously we have contemplated the need for [[complementary notice on fork]]. Here, I start to think through how such a mechanism might work. I draw inspiration from [https://indiewebcamp.com/webmention Webmention].

title: Wikipedia Links
synopsis: I propose here a change or addition to Fedwiki to make the integration with [[Wikipedia]] (and [[Other MediaWikis]]), more seamless.

title: Wikipedia Page Previews
synopsis: Navigating through Wikipedia articles on desktop just got a lot easier. Page previews solves the core problem of readers needing to go back and forth between articles or open multiple tabs to gain an understanding of a word or concept within the context of the subject they are reading.[https://blog.wikimedia.org/2018/04/17/wikipedia-page-previews/ wikipedia]

title: WikiPLACE Second Pilot
synopsis: WikiPLACE is a simple urban scenario-modeling system with the ease of use of a web -based wiki, combined with the power of numerical calculations. It uses the new "Federated Wiki" system now in development by wiki inventor Ward Cunningham.

title: Wiki's Most Replicated
synopsis: I've suggested that a certain writing style favors replication. Can we learn something about style by study of replications we find by search? Not yet. But maybe.

title: Wind River Confluence
synopsis: This confluence is in the Wind River section of the Gifford Pinchot National Forest. It is sixteen miles southeast of Mount Saint Helens, famous for the 1980 eruption the resulted in nearly 150 square miles of forest blown over or left dead and standing and a column of ash that drifted downwind over eastern Washington and beyond. September 23, 2000. [http://c2.com/ward/confluence/n46w122 site]

title: Wither the Gray Web
synopsis: In the beginning html was described in a ten page document and the sites so rendered appeared with gray background in the browsers of the day. No longer.

title: Without a King?
synopsis: This radiolab.org podcast becomes a discussion of how to freeze search results or any other generated output of lasting value.

title: Work in Progress
synopsis: These are projects we've actually started coding. Sometimes they turn out to have dependencies we hadn't anticipated which makes them linger on.

title: Worked Progressed
synopsis: These projects got some attention and either stalled or reached sufficient completion to slip off of our radar.

title: World Time Forecast
synopsis: We imagine a slide rule useful for scheduling and awaiting events where offsets that change with seasons and prefered times of participants are taken into account.

title: Yellow Local
synopsis: A page found in the browser's local storage shows with a yellow border.

title: Zero-Steps to Claim
synopsis: A new site could be "born claimed". The server could generate a suitable credential and share it with the first visitor's browser. This initiates the "claim" process. Let's call this the zero-steps to claim solution. We here consider how it could then be supplemented with more traditional account management and login mechanisms.

title: DNS Check
synopsis: My DNS config has gotten sufficiently complicated that I won't move things around without some double check on my work. This ruby program has worked well.

title: Computational Plasticity
synopsis: We wonder, how can a computation operate usefully in a broad range of applications? We have some simple examples. Here we try to imagine more.

title: Enabling Activity
synopsis: We speak of freezing and thawing the activity of plugins that draw information from their surroundings.
